## Single View - EDW Optimization

#### Goal

Demonstrate how [Apache Hive](http://hortonworks.com/hadoop/hive/) can help retailers get a single view of a product by combining data from different sources and run interative queries against the data.

Data sources for this lab are:
  - ETL/CRM data from EDW/DB - ingested using [Apache Sqoop](http://hortonworks.com/hadoop/sqoop/)
  - Web traffic data - ingested using [HDF](http://hortonworks.com/hdf)
  - Social media data - ingested using [HDF](http://hortonworks.com/hdf)
  
#### Steps

1. Use Sqoop to import CRM/ERP data from DB/EDW into Hive
2. Use HDF to import related tweets into Hive
3. Use HDF to import simulated web traffic logs into Hive
4. Use Hive to analyze tables to populate statistics
5. Use Hive to correlate the data from multiple data sources

Note: this is a simplified version of the demo. A more realistic self-lab of this content is available that: 
  - runs the steps as either IT user (for setup) or marketing user (as business user running queries)
  - uses Ranger to setup authorization policies and audit

More details at: [https://github.com/abajwa-hw/single-view-demo](https://github.com/abajwa-hw/single-view-demo)

paragraphs.title: Check access to PostgreSQL tables from sqoop
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sqoop list-tables --connect jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/contoso --username zeppelin --password zeppelin -- schema contoso

paragraphs.title: Bulk load tables from PostgreSQL into Hive
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sqoop import-all-tables \
  --username zeppelin --password zeppelin --connect jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/contoso \
  --hive-import --direct --create-hcatalog-table \
  --hcatalog-storage-stanza 'stored as orc TBLPROPERTIES ("transactional"="true")' >> /tmp/zeppelin.out 2>&1

%md
#### The above may run for a 5-10 minutes.

- You can track the jobs from the YARN Resource Manager UI.
  - *Find it from the YARN QuickLinks in Ambari*

paragraphs.title: Put factsales into buckets
paragraphs.text:
%hive(default)
ALTER TABLE factsales CLUSTERED BY (saleskey) INTO 7 BUCKETS

paragraphs.title: Confirm tables created in hive (text format)

paragraphs.text:
%md

#### Incremental import of data into Hive from RDBMS

Now that we did the one time bulk import, next we will setup an incremental sqoop job

First we create password file containing zeppelin user's PostGres password in HDFS. This is done to allow invocations of the job to be automated/scheduled (without having to manually pass the password )

result.msg:
Incremental import of data into Hive from RDBMS

Now that we did the one time bulk import, next we will setup an incremental sqoop job

First we create password file containing zeppelin user's PostGres password in HDFS. This is done to allow invocations of the job to be automated/scheduled (without having to manually pass the password )

paragraphs.title: Store PostgreSQL password (see Hadoop docs for secure method)
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# use -n to ensure newline is not added
echo -n "zeppelin" > .password
hadoop fs -put .password /user/zeppelin/
rm .password

paragraphs.title: Create incremental sqoop job
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sqoop job -create factsales -- import --verbose \
  --connect 'jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/contoso' \
  --username zeppelin --password-file hdfs://0.0.0.0:8020/user/zeppelin/.password \
  --table factsales --check-column updatedate --incremental lastmodified --last-value '2015-01-01' \
  --hive-import --direct \
  >> /tmp/zeppelin.out 2>&1

%md
#### Explanation for the incremental sqoop command above

The prior command created an incremental import sqoop job for factsales table using these switches: 
  - --table: table the job is for (i.e. factsales)
  - --password-file: the HDFS location of the password file
  - --incremental: lastmodified (we want to use lastmodified logic to find delta records)
  - --check-column: specify which column that will be used to determine which delta records will be picked up (in this case, records whose updatedate column value is later than 2015-01-01 will be picked up)
  - see [Sqoop documentation on incremental imports](https://sqoop.apache.org/docs/1.4.2/SqoopUserGuide.html#_incremental_imports) for more details

paragraphs.title: Update 2 records of FactSales table (in Postgres)
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD=zeppelin
psql -U zeppelin -d contoso -h localhost -c "update factsales set updatedate = '2016-01-01 00:00:00' where saleskey in (3,4);"

%md
## Done with EDW Optimization

At this point we have shown how you can bulk import data from EDW/RDBMS into Hive and then incrementally keep the Hive tables periodically updated
